title: Update new RetNet settings
Adding sqrt in the recurrent_forward of retnet to make it consistent with parallel_forward
body: Adding sqrt in the recurrent_forward of retnet can avoid numerical underflow thus improving consistency and performance. https://github.com/microsoft/torchscale/issues/47

title: Config fix
body:
I've rewritten the `torchscale.architecture.config` module to use inheritance and remove the redundant code. There are now 3 classes:

`Config` - that holds all common options
`EncoderConfig` - inherits 'Config' and holds Encoder specific options
`DecoderConfig` - inherits 'Config' and holds Decoder specific options
`EncoderDecoderConfig` - inherits `EncoderConfig` and `DecoderConfig` and holds that one option shared by Encoder and Decoder objects.

I also took the liberty to add some type hints for `args` parameters in encoder/decoder modules.

title: Remove inheritance from `object`
body: 5 classes in the codebase inherit from `object` for some reason. I am guessing it was some sort of an oversight.

title: support lm prefix computation in one go
body: In LM decoding with prefix (e.g., prompt), we can compute all prefix hidden states all together in the first step by setting `incremental_state["is_first_step"] = True`

title: add basic test
body: Currently, the `test_encoder_decoder.py` in the `tests` directory fails its tests because the `EncoderDecoderConfig` class lacks the `normalize_output` element. Please fix this bug and update the code so that it passes the tests defined in `workflows/test.yml`.

title: Bump timm version to latest
body:
The timm version is quite old and missing several models (e.g. beit).

This PR bumps the timm version to the latest.

Test plan:

- `pip install -e .` successful without conflicts
- Tests passed except for `test_encoder_decoder.py` which was failing before this PR anyway

title: Swapped naive dot product attention for flash attention
body:
This pull request adds support for the Flash Attention mechanism to the MultiheadAttention module. Flash Attention is a recently proposed alternative to the conventional multi-head attention mechanism which reduces memory usage and improves training efficiency. The implementation in this pull request follows the paper "FlashAttention: Fast and Memory-Efficient Exact Attention with IO-Awareness" (https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.14135)

Changes Made:

* Replaced the conventional multi-head attention mechanism with the Flash 
  Attention mechanism in the forward() method.
* Added support for the key_padding_mask argument to the F.scaled_dot_product_attention() function.
* Updated the incremental_state logic to work with the new tensor shapes introduced by Flash Attention.
* Applied the xpos method to both the q and k tensors in the forward() method.
Replaced **masked_fill** with the additive mask to combine the attention mask and key padding mask.  
Please review and merge.

title: fx BERT + moe
body:
- add `--use-moe` argument
- add '--pad-to-max-length` argument in pretraining task
- set numpy version to 1.23.0

title: Adding the official implementation of Xpos (https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.10554)
fix a bug that overrides the default constructed output_projection
body:
Fixes a bug that overrides the default constructed output_projection when `None` is passed in.

L228-235 

```
 if (
     output_projection is None
     and not args.no_output_layer
     and args.vocab_size > 0
 ):
     self.output_projection = self.build_output_projection(args)
 else:
     self.output_projection = output_projection
```
seems to already handle this properly. 

This PR removes a line that overrides the above unnecessarily.

title: don't need attn weight in decoder
body: Attention weight was originally designed for alignment models, so it is not necessary to include it in torchscale.

title: fix typo
body: So sorry @shumingma I had the name wrong!
